skill.name: python-testing-patterns
skill.description: Implement comprehensive testing strategies with pytest, fixtures, mocking, and test-driven development. Use when writing Python tests, setting up test suites, or implementing testing best practices.
skill.summary: Implement comprehensive testing strategies with pytest, fixtures, mocking, and test-driven developme...

security_audit.summary: Reviewed the single SKILL.md guide with code examples. No file access, network calls, or executable scripts are present. Content is instructional and matches the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Writing good tests can be slow and inconsistent. This skill provides proven pytest patterns, fixtures, and mocking guidance you can apply immediately.
actual_capabilities: Provide pytest unit test examples with AAA structure
Show fixture setup, teardown, and scope patterns
Explain mocking with unittest.mock and patch
Introduce property based testing with hypothesis
limitations: Does not run tests or verify results
Does not inspect your codebase without provided snippets
Examples are generic and may need adaptation
Does not generate full project scaffolding

use_cases.title: Create robust unit tests
use_cases.description: Apply pytest patterns to cover core business logic with clear, maintainable tests.

use_cases.title: Standardize test suites
use_cases.description: Use fixtures, markers, and parametrization to build consistent test infrastructure.

use_cases.title: Validate data utilities
use_cases.description: Add fast unit tests and property based checks for data processing functions.

prompt_templates.title: Write a first test
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner writing a simple unit test
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a basic pytest test for a function that adds two numbers using the AAA pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Use fixtures
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pytest fixture for a database client and show one test that uses it.

prompt_templates.title: Mock an API
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a pytest example that mocks requests.get and asserts the call arguments.

prompt_templates.title: Async and property tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline how to test an async function and add one property based test example.

output_examples.input: Help me test a service that calls an external API and caches results
output: Use a fixture to create a service instance with a temporary cache
Mock the HTTP call and assert it is called only once
Add a second call test to confirm cached behavior

best_practices: Keep tests independent and clean up shared state
Use fixtures for setup and teardown instead of manual boilerplate
Parametrize tests to cover edge cases with minimal duplication
anti_patterns: Sharing mutable global state across tests
Asserting too many behaviors in one test
Hitting live external services in unit tests

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported
faq.answer: The guidance targets modern Python and pytest, typically 3.9 or newer.

faq.question: Are there limits on test types
faq.answer: It focuses on unit, integration, async, and property based patterns.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI pipeline
faq.answer: It provides CI examples you can adapt for your workflow.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance based on prompts and examples.

faq.question: What if my tests still fail
faq.answer: Share the failing output and code snippet for targeted advice.

faq.question: How is it different from generic advice
faq.answer: It provides concrete pytest patterns, fixtures, and mocking examples.
